channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DHS expected to shut down as talks over immigration enforcement reform falter
item.description: A stopgap bill to temporarily fund the Department of Homeland Security expires Friday night. DHS could be without funding for days, as the House and Senate are expected to be in recess next week.
item.content:encoded: A stopgap bill to temporarily fund the Department of Homeland Security expires Friday night. DHS could be without funding for days, as the House and Senate are expected to be in recess next week.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: Sen. Ruben Gallego talks about debate over DHS funding as deadline approaches
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Democratic Sen. Ruben Gallego of Arizona about the fight over funding for the Department of Homeland Security.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Democratic Sen. Ruben Gallego of Arizona about the fight over funding for the Department of Homeland Security.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The surge of federal agents in Minnesota is coming to an end, DHS expected to shut down as funding deadline approaches, EPA will stop regulating greenhouse gases.
item.content:encoded: The surge of federal agents in Minnesota is coming to an end, DHS expected to shut down as funding deadline approaches, EPA will stop regulating greenhouse gases.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Carnival and award seasons collide as Brazilians root for Oscar-nominated film
item.description: During Brazil's Carnival season, locals are rooting hard for their country's entry at the Oscars, "The Secret Agent." The film is up for four awards, including Best Picture.
item.content:encoded: During Brazil's Carnival season, locals are rooting hard for their country's entry at the Oscars, "The Secret Agent." The film is up for four awards, including Best Picture.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Snowboarder Chloe Kim takes home silver in the halfpipe, ending bid for three-peat
item.description: Snowboarder Chloe Kim's quest for an Olympic halfpipe three-peat was foiled by her protégé. Kim took home silver, edged out in the final round by 17-year-old Gaon Choi of South Korea.
item.content:encoded: Snowboarder Chloe Kim's quest for an Olympic halfpipe three-peat was foiled by her protégé. Kim took home silver, edged out in the final round by 17-year-old Gaon Choi of South Korea.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: World leaders to discuss the future of Europe's security in Munich
item.description: World leaders will meet at the Munich Security Conference Friday to discuss the future of Europe's security.
item.content:encoded: World leaders will meet at the Munich Security Conference Friday to discuss the future of Europe's security.
item.dc:creator: Mary Louise Kelly

item.title: These foreign correspondents covered hard to reach places. Then, they were laid off
item.description: The Washington Post laid off most of its foreign correspondents, including some of the last American and Western journalists working in authoritarian countries.
item.content:encoded: The Washington Post laid off most of its foreign correspondents, including some of the last American and Western journalists working in authoritarian countries.
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: How college football became a financial engine for Olympic training
item.description: College football has become the uniquely American engine that pays for the training of future US Olympians. The Indicator's Wailin Wong and Adrian Ma go back in time to the Cold War to explain why.
item.content:encoded: College football has become the uniquely American engine that pays for the training of future US Olympians. The Indicator's Wailin Wong and Adrian Ma go back in time to the Cold War to explain why.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: Western states fight over a river that is disappearing
item.description: Seven Western states are deadlocked over how to share the Colorado River, which is critically low. They are expected to miss Saturday's deadline to come to a water use agreement.
item.content:encoded: Seven Western states are deadlocked over how to share the Colorado River, which is critically low. They are expected to miss Saturday's deadline to come to a water use agreement.
item.dc:creator: Alex Hager

item.title: Swing voters in Arizona say ICE should be reformed
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks to Rich Thau, who runs focus groups with swing voters and recently asked for their opinions on the Trump administration's immigration policies.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks to Rich Thau, who runs focus groups with swing voters and recently asked for their opinions on the Trump administration's immigration policies.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep
